meaningMnemonic: You <radical>thread</radical> <radical>someone</radical> <kanji>together</kanji> with thread. Someone is falling apart so you use thread to put them back together.
readingMnemonic: You’re threading this someone back <kanji>together</kanji> as part of a <reading>show</reading> (しょ). The show is a demonstration to show med students how to thread someone’s skin together after they have an accident. You’re the most experienced, so you’re leading the show.
